thread.title: Normal map plugin for lightwave? HOW TO DO IT ?

post.author: Phobos
post.body:
Can ANYONE tell me how to get a normal map out of my high poly, and onto my low poly, using lightwave?

A newbie step-by-step process would be GREAT! Please!

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
Phobos wrote:
Can ANYONE tell me how to get a normal map out of my high poly, and onto my low poly, using lightwave?

A newbie step-by-step process would be GREAT! Please!


Use the normal map rendering feature of Doom3 - plenty of step by step tuts available.

post.author: Phobos
post.body:
Are you referring to the renderbump console command?

I've done a lot of researching and haven't really found any good newbie-me tutorials. I just found the renderbumpflat thing in the modwiki and I'm trying to understand if that's what I'm looking for?

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
Phobos wrote:
Are you referring to the renderbump console command?

I've done a lot of researching and haven't really found any good newbie-me tutorials. I just found the renderbumpflat thing in the modwiki and I'm trying to understand if that's what I'm looking for?


Yes - it's renderbump.

Renderbumpflat is to extract the normal of a "plane" when looking top down.
